result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffry W Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 70 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Remainder of fine to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Bail applied to DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel.

Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Driver's License.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffry W Dixon in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mother of the minor child identified in the criminal complaint makes statements.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1

Sentence of 

6 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 70 days )

2 Years of Initial Confinement

4 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of extended supervision:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;

Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;

FINE:  $2577.00  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

DNA Surcharge: $250.00  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

DL REVOCATION:  6 years

IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 6 years

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 

AODA Assessment and follow through

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
